title: Akila de Silva | Department of Computer Science
content:
Akila de Silva
Assistant Professor
Email:
desilva@sfsu.edu
Location:
Thornton Hall 968
Office Hours:
Mon:
2:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m.
Join Zoom Meeting:
http://zoom.us/j/4728433340pwd=SmZPK3dzZW5uWTNrdnc4TjBMV0dNUT09
Website
Biography
Areas of Expertise
Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computer vision, Visualization, Applied AI
Publications
Khan, F. H., Lovell, E.,de Silva, A. Dusek, G., Davis, J., Pang, A. "WIP: Citizen Science Tools with Machine Learning as a Pathway to Engage High School Students in Research". Accepted at Frontiers in Education.
Dusek, D.,Hernandez, D., Long, J., Porter, D., Pang, A., Cothran, J.,Schandera, L., Showalter, L., Rhoades, J, Sager, C., Palmsten, M, de Silva, A., Khan, F. and Jass, T., “Expanding partnerships, products and use-cases for an operational coastal web camera observation network” In: Ocean Sciences Meeting 2024. AGU.
de Silva, A., Zhao, M.◦, Stewart D.◦, Khan, F. H., Dusek, G., Davis, J., Pang, A. “RipViz: Finding Rip Currents by Learning Pathline Behavior.” In: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (TVCG) 2023.
https://doi.org/10.1109/TVCG.2023.3243834
Luo, J., Khan, F. H.,Mori, I., de Silva, A., Ruezga, E. S., Pang, A., Davis, J. “How Much Does Input Data Type Impact Final FaceModel Accuracy?.” In: IEEE Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR) 2022.
https://doi.org/10.1109/CVPR52688.2022.01841
Mori, I., de Silva, A., Dusek, G., Davis, J., Pang, A. “Flow-based Rip Current Detection and Visualization.” In: IEEE Access 2022.
https://doi.org/10.1109/ACCESS.2022.3140340
Khan, F. H., de Silva, A., Dusek, G., Davis, J., Pang, A. “A Citizen Science Platform for Creating ML-poweredMobile Apps to Collect Visual Data.” In: Conference on Computer Supported CooperativeWork and Social Computing (CSCW) 2021.
https://doi.org/10.1145/3462204.3481743
De Silva, A.,Mori, I., Dusek, G., Davis, J., Pang, A. “Automated rip current detection with region based convolutional neural networks.” In: Coastal Engineering.
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.coastaleng.2021.103859
Luo, J., Khan, F. H.,Mori, I., de Silva, A., Ruezga, E.S., Davis, J. “FaceModels: How Good DoesMy Data Need To Be?.” In: IEEE ICIP 2021.
https://doi.org/10.1109/ICIP42928.2021.9506668
Khan, F. H.∗, de Silva, A.∗, Yetukuri, J.∗, Norouzi, N.∗ “Sequential Image Synthesis for Human Activity Video Generation.” In: International Conference on Image Analysis and Recognition (pp. 129-133). ∗ equal contribution.
https://doi.org/10.1007/978−3−030−27272−2_11
Dusek, G., Churma, M., Im, J. S., Pang, A., de Silva, A.,Mori, I. “From Lifeguards to AI:Advancing Rip Current Forecasting Through New DetectionMethods.” In: Ocean Sciences Meeting 2020. AGU.
de Silva, A., Tee, N. Ganekar, O., Khan, F. H., Dusek, G., Davis, J., Pang, A.  VortexViz: Finding Vortices by Learning from particle trajectories.
https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2404.01352
Awards and Grants
Michael Richman Award,
with Professor Leigh Jin and Professor Weimin Zhang, for 2024-25.

title: James Wong | Department of Computer Science
content:
James Wong
Professor
Email:
jwong@sfsu.edu
James Wong Website
Biography
Areas of Expertise
Analysis of Algorithms
Internet Applications
System Testing Strategies
Scheduling Algorithms
Publications
Dynamic path planning for mobile beacons in wireless sensor network localization" (with Wen Ouyang, Hao-Chun Hsieh), The 8th International Workshop on Performance Evaluation of Wireless Networks (PEWiN-2016)
“Heuristics for Reconfigurable Three Dimensional Free Space,” (with J, Kosumo, D. Luong and G. Young), The 19th International Conference on Parallel and Distributed Processing Techniques and Applications, pp 423-429, Las Vegas, Nevada, July 2013.
“A Formal Methodology to Determine Functional Stress Testing Criteria,” (with H. Luo), 1/2013.

title: Isabel Hyo Jung Song | Department of Computer Science
content:
Isabel Hyo Jung Song
Associate Professor
Undergraduate Advisor
Phone:
(415) 338-7688
Email:
hjsong@sfsu.edu
Location:
Thornton Hall 909
Isabel Hyo Jung Song LinkedIn
Biography
Areas of Expertise
Mobile Computing
Software Engineering
Entrepreneurship
On-device AI
Machine Learning
Publications
S. Mostafa*, Isabel HJ Song, N. Strauli**, N. Sewde**, M. Friesenhahn**, M. Usdin**, X. Jia**, “A framework for predicting progression in primary progressive multiple sclerosis using machine learning and statistical methods”, IEEE Bioinformatics and Biomedicine(BIBM), Dec. 2021. (* denotes a student that I mentored from SFSU and ** denotes staff at Genentech I collaborated with.)
T. Touati*, K. Okada**, Isabel HJ Song, “What makes a person obese? :An individual-level analysis of obesity”, IEEE Biomedical and Health Informatics (BHI), Jul. 2021. (* denotes a student that I mentored from SFSU, and ** denotes a SFSU faculty I collaborated with.)
Ja-Hee Kim**, Chanhyuk Park, Isabel HJ Song, “An Empirical Analysis of the Benefits of Agile Process”, Journal of Information Technology Services, Mar. 2021 (** denotes a visiting scholar at SFSU I collaborated with.)
U Khyoi Nu*, Tahar Touati*, Srushti Buddhadev*, Ruopen Sun, Matthew Smuck, and Isabel HJ Song, “Who is physically active? : Classification and analysis of Physical activity using NHANES data”, IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence, Dec 2020. (* denotes students that I mentored from SFSU.)
Isabel HJ Song, W. Yazar, A.Tsang*, The self-upgrading mobile application for the automatic malaria detection, 10th Annual Computing and Communication Workshop and Conference, 2020. (* denotes students that I mentored from SFSU)

title: Hui Yang | Department of Computer Science
content:
Hui Yang
Professor
Phone:
(415) 338-2221
Email:
huiyang@sfsu.edu
Location:
Thornton Hall 966
Hui Yang Website
Biography
Areas of Expertise
Data Mining
Text Mining and Information Extraction with a Current Focus in Biomedical Application
Protein Structure Analysis
Awards
GE Predix Challenge Grant, $10,000, 2017
Collaborative research project with IBM Almaden on annotating and extracting entities and relationships in biomedical articles. January 2013-February 2014. Budget: $20,000.
Collaborative research project with Genentech on curating bio-entities and software testing and quality assessment. October 2011—June 2012. Budget: $10,000.
Publications
A Systematic study of eleven feature selection algorithms and their impact on the text classification task, Suchi Vora** and Hui Yang. IEEE Computing Conference 2017, July 18-20, 2017, London.
Two Simple and Effective Ensemble Classifiers for Twitter Sentiment Analysis. Yeqing Yan**, Hui Yang, and Hui-ming Wang. IEEE Computing Conference 2017, July 18-20, 2017, London.
A Multifaceted Data Mining Approach to Understanding What Factors Lead College Students to Persist and Graduate, Aparna Gopalakrishnan**, Hui Yang, Celia Graterol, Rama Kassed, Mary Beth Love, and Alycia Shada. IEEE Computing Conference 2017, July 18-20, 2017, London.
"Structuring unstructured clinical narratives in OpenMRS with medical concept extraction," Ryan M. Eshleman*, Hui Yang and Barry Levine. In the proceedings of the IEEE International Conference on Bioinformatics and Biomedicine (BIBM2015) (industrial track). November 2015, Washington DC.
